titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Asia Society collection FA1771

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-17 11:17:15 -0500.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Asia Society was founded in 1956 by John D. Rockefeller 3rd to promote greater knowledge and understanding of Asia in the United States, and to strengthen the relationship between Americans and Asians through international cultural exchange. The Asia Society has grown to become a global institution with an educational mandate and cross-disciplinary programming.

The Asia Society headquarters are located in New York, and the Society maintains additional U.S. offices in California (Los Angeles and San Francisco), Texas (Houston) and Washington, D.C. and global centers in Australia (Melbourne), China (Shanghai), Hong Kong, India (Mumbai), South Korea (Seoul), and the Philippines (Manila).
